definitions.definition: To go with or attend as a companion or associate; to keep company with; to go along with.
definitions.example: Geoffrey accompanied the group on their pilgrimage.

definitions.definition: To perform an accompanying part or parts in a composition.
To perform an accompanying part next to (another instrument or musician).
definitions.example: I will accompany her on the oboe.

definitions.definition: To associate in a company; to keep company.
To cohabit with; to coexist with; occur with.
To be found at the same time.
definitions.example: Thunder almost always accompanies lightning during a rain storm.
